TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit MsalMtlsHttpClientFactory extends System.Object implements class Microsoft.Identity.Client.IMsalHttpClientFactory, class Microsoft.Identity.Client.IMsalMtlsHttpClientFactory, class System.IDisposable
Public NotInheritable Class MsalMtlsHttpClientFactory Implements IDisposable, IMsalMtlsHttpClientFactory
type MsalMtlsHttpClientFactory = class interface IMsalMtlsHttpClientFactory interface IMsalHttpClientFactory interface IDisposable

Docs.summary: Provides a factory for creating HTTP clients configured for mTLS authentication with using binding certificate. It uses a hybrid approach with leveraging IHttpClientFactory for non-mTLS HTTP clients and maintaining a pool of mTLS clients with using certificate thumbprint as a key.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Net.Http.IHttpClientFactory httpClientFactory) cil managed

Docs.param: The factory used to create HttpClient instances for mutual TLS (mTLS) operations. Cannot be null.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the MsalMtlsHttpClientFactory class using the specified HTTP client factory.

Docs.summary: Creates and configures a new instance of with telemetry headers applied.
Docs.returns: A new instance with telemetry information included in the default request headers.
Docs.remarks: The returned includes a telemetry header for tracking or diagnostics purposes. Callers are responsible for disposing the instance when it is no longer needed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Net.Http.HttpClient GetHttpClient(class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 x509Certificate2) cil managed
Public Function GetHttpClient (x509Certificate2 As X509Certificate2) As HttpClient

abstract member GetHttpClient : System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 -> System.Net.Http.HttpClient override this.GetHttpClient : System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 -> System.Net.Http.HttpClient

Docs.param: The X.509 certificate to use for client authentication. If , a default instance without client certificate authentication is returned.
Docs.summary: Returns an instance of configured to use the specified X.509 client certificate for mutual TLS authentication.
Docs.returns: A instance configured for mutual TLS authentication using the specified certificate or default instance.
Docs.remarks: The returned instance is pooled and reused for the given certificate. The client includes a telemetry header in each request. Callers should not modify the default request headers or dispose the returned instance.
